alert.note: Alert for Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sierra County Lakes (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 2:58PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Sierra County through 330 PM MDT... At 258 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Caballo, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arrey, Caballo, Palomas, Ladder Ranch, Lower Animas Creek, Lower Palomas Canyon, and Caballo Lake. This includes Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 56 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sierra County Lakes
